title: Credit Guarantee Fund Trust for Micro and Small Enterprises (CGTMSE)
description: Credit guarantee scheme providing collateral-free credit to micro and small enterprises. CGTMSE guarantees up to 85% of the sanctioned amount, enabling MSMEs to access credit without third-party guarantees or collateral security.
eligibility: New and existing micro and small enterprises in manufacturing and service sectors. Eligible for credit facilities up to ₹200 lakhs (₹2 crore). Both individual and institutional borrowers can apply through member lending institutions.
benefits: Collateral-free loans up to ₹200 lakhs. Credit guarantee coverage of 75-85% of sanctioned amount. No requirement for third-party guarantees. Reduced interest rates due to lower risk for lenders. Quick loan processing and approval.
application_process: 1. Prepare business plan and project report. 2. Approach any CGTMSE member lending institution (banks, NBFCs). 3. Submit loan application with required documents. 4. Bank evaluates and sanctions loan under CGTMSE coverage. 5. Receive loan without collateral requirement.

title: Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP)
description: Major credit-linked subsidy program for generating self-employment opportunities through establishment of micro-enterprises in non-farm sector. Administered by KVIC, the scheme provides margin money subsidy ranging from 15% to 35% of project cost.
eligibility: Any individual above 18 years. Minimum educational qualification: 8th standard pass for projects costing above ₹10 lakhs in manufacturing sector and above ₹5 lakhs in service sector. For special categories (SC/ST/OBC/Minorities/Women/Ex-servicemen/Physically Handicapped/NER/Hill and Border areas), no educational qualification required. Only new projects are eligible.
benefits: Subsidy of 15-35% of project cost (15-25% for general category in urban areas, 25-35% for special categories and rural areas). Maximum project cost: ₹50 lakhs for manufacturing and ₹20 lakhs for service sector. Working capital and term loan at subsidized interest rates. Training support for skill development.
application_process: 1. Register on PMEGP e-portal (www.kviconline.gov.in/pmegpeportal). 2. Fill online application with project details. 3. Submit application to KVIC/KVIB/DIC. 4. Attend EDP (Entrepreneurship Development Programme) training if required. 5. Get project sanctioned by bank. 6. Establish enterprise and claim subsidy.
deadline: Ongoing - Applications accepted throughout the year

title: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)
description: Flagship skill development scheme providing free short-term training and certification to Indian youth. PMKVY offers industry-relevant skill training in over 300 job roles across 37 sectors with placement assistance and monetary rewards for successful candidates.
eligibility: Indian citizens aged 15-45 years who are unemployed, school/college dropouts, or seeking to enhance their skills. No minimum educational qualification required for most courses. Priority given to youth from economically weaker sections, SC/ST, and minority communities.
benefits: Free skill training in 300+ job roles across 37 sectors. Course duration: 150-300 hours. Government-recognized certification upon successful completion. Monetary reward of ₹8,000 on average for successful candidates. Placement assistance through industry partnerships. Accommodation and meals during residential training.
application_process: 1. Visit PMKVY portal (www.pmkvyofficial.org) or nearest PMKVY Training Center. 2. Register with Aadhaar and basic details. 3. Choose training course based on interest and local demand. 4. Enroll in nearest training center. 5. Complete training and appear for assessment. 6. Receive certificate and monetary reward. 7. Access placement assistance.
deadline: Ongoing with regular batches throughout the year
ministry: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship

title: Zero Defect Zero Effect (ZED) Certification
description: Integrated and comprehensive certification system for MSMEs focusing on quality and environmental management. ZED promotes adoption of zero defect production and zero adverse environmental and ecological impact, enhancing global competitiveness of Indian MSMEs.
eligibility: All micro, small, and medium enterprises registered in India. Manufacturing and service sector MSMEs can apply. Enterprises must be willing to adopt quality management systems and environmental best practices.
benefits: Subsidized certification costs (80% subsidy for micro enterprises, 60% for small enterprises). International recognition of quality standards. Improved competitiveness in domestic and global markets. Reduced wastage and improved efficiency. Access to government procurement preferences. Technical handholding and consultancy support.
application_process: 1. Register on ZED portal (www.zed.msme.gov.in). 2. Complete online self-assessment. 3. Apply for ZED certification. 4. Undergo ZED assessment by certified agencies. 5. Implement recommended improvements. 6. Receive ZED certification (Bronze/Silver/Gold based on score). 7. Claim subsidy for certification costs.

title: National SC-ST Hub
description: Initiative to promote entrepreneurship among Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes by facilitating their participation in public procurement. The scheme provides handholding support, capacity building, and marketing assistance to SC/ST entrepreneurs.
eligibility: Enterprises owned by Scheduled Caste (SC) or Scheduled Tribe (ST) entrepreneurs. At least 51% ownership and management control should be with SC/ST persons. Enterprise must be registered and operational.
benefits: Tender information and bid preparation support. Capacity building and skill development programs. Marketing assistance and buyer-seller meets. Consortium formation support for large orders. Access to government procurement opportunities (4% sub-target for SC/ST enterprises). Financial linkages and credit facilitation.
application_process: 1. Register enterprise on National SC-ST Hub portal. 2. Submit ownership and caste certificates. 3. Complete enterprise profile with products/services details. 4. Access tender information and training programs. 5. Participate in buyer-seller meets and exhibitions. 6. Apply for government tenders with Hub support. 7. Receive handholding for order execution.

title: Udaan Training Programme for Unemployed Youth of J&K
description: Special initiative for unemployed youth of Jammu & Kashmir providing comprehensive training and placement support. The program focuses on enhancing employability through skill development, soft skills training, and industry exposure.
eligibility: Unemployed youth from Jammu & Kashmir aged 18-35 years. Graduates and diploma holders from recognized institutions. Preference given to youth from remote and rural areas of J&K.
benefits: Free residential training program. Industry-relevant skill development. Soft skills and personality development training. Industry exposure through internships. Placement assistance with leading companies. Travel allowance and stipend during training. Post-placement tracking and support.
application_process: 1. Check eligibility criteria on official portal. 2. Register online with educational and personal details. 3. Appear for selection process (written test/interview). 4. Selected candidates undergo residential training. 5. Complete internship with partner companies. 6. Receive placement support. 7. Join employment with partner organizations.
ministry: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship

title: Apprenticeship Training
description: Statutory scheme under Apprentices Act 1961 providing practical training to youth in industry. Combines theoretical knowledge with hands-on experience, preparing apprentices for skilled employment while providing stipend during training period.
eligibility: Youth aged 14-40 years (relaxation for SC/ST/PWD). Educational qualification varies by trade: 5th pass for optional trades, 8th pass for designated trades, 10th/12th/ITI/Diploma/Graduate for technical trades. Indian citizens seeking practical industrial training.
benefits: Practical training in real industrial environment. Monthly stipend (minimum 70% of minimum wages for skilled workers). Training duration: 6 months to 4 years depending on trade. Government-recognized certificate upon completion. Enhanced employability and job-ready skills. Potential for absorption in training establishment.
application_process: 1. Register on National Apprenticeship Training Scheme (NATS) portal. 2. Search for apprenticeship opportunities by trade/location. 3. Apply to establishments offering apprenticeship. 4. Appear for selection process. 5. Sign apprenticeship contract. 6. Undergo training and receive monthly stipend. 7. Complete training and receive certificate.

title: Craftsmen Training Scheme (ITI)
description: Vocational training program through Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs) providing skill-based education in various trades. ITI training prepares youth for skilled employment in industry with nationally recognized certification.
eligibility: Youth aged 14-40 years. Educational qualification: 8th pass for most trades, 10th pass for some technical trades, 12th pass for advanced courses. Both male and female candidates eligible. Reservation as per government norms for SC/ST/OBC/PWD.
benefits: Comprehensive vocational training in 130+ trades. Duration: 6 months to 2 years. Government-recognized National Trade Certificate (NTC). Highly employable skills in manufacturing and service sectors. Pathway to higher education through Apprenticeship/Diploma. Placement assistance through employment exchanges. Low course fees with scholarships for economically weaker sections.
application_process: 1. Check ITI admission schedule in your state. 2. Register on state ITI admission portal. 3. Fill application form with trade preferences. 4. Submit required documents. 5. Appear for entrance test (if applicable) or merit-based selection. 6. Attend counseling and select ITI and trade. 7. Complete admission formalities and join training.

title: Revamped Scheme of Fund for Regeneration of Traditional Industries (SFURTI)
description: Scheme for regenerating traditional industries by organizing artisans into clusters and providing them with improved infrastructure, technology, skills, and market access. SFURTI aims to make traditional industries sustainable and competitive.
eligibility: Artisans, traditional industry workers, and rural entrepreneurs engaged in khadi, village industries, coir, and other traditional crafts. Clusters of minimum 500 artisans for major clusters and 200 for mini clusters. Preference to SC/ST artisans and women artisans.
benefits: Financial assistance up to ₹2.5 crore for major clusters and ₹1.5 crore for mini clusters. Common Facility Centre (CFC) establishment. Raw material procurement support. Technology upgradation and modern equipment. Skill development and design training. Marketing support and brand building. Working capital assistance.
application_process: 1. Form artisan cluster with minimum required members. 2. Identify implementing agency (NGO/Industry Association/Government body). 3. Prepare detailed project report (DPR). 4. Submit application to KVIC/Coir Board. 5. Get DPR approved by Project Approval Committee. 6. Implement cluster development activities. 7. Establish Common Facility Centre and provide training. 8. Access marketing support and brand development.
deadline: Ongoing - Applications accepted throughout the year

title: Aspire (Scheme for Promotion of Innovation, Rural Industry and Entrepreneurship)
description: Scheme to promote agro-industry through establishment of Livelihood Business Incubators (LBIs) and Technology Business Incubators (TBIs). ASPIRE supports innovation and entrepreneurship in agro-rural industry sectors, creating sustainable livelihoods.
eligibility: For LBIs: Rural entrepreneurs, farmer producer organizations, self-help groups in agro-based industries. For TBIs: Startups and innovators in agro-processing, food processing, and related sectors. Preference to SC/ST/Women entrepreneurs and those in aspirational districts.
benefits: Financial support for setting up incubators. Funding for startups (up to ₹25 lakhs per startup). Mentorship and handholding support. Access to modern technology and equipment. Market linkages and networking. Training in business management and technical skills. Subsidized workspace and common facilities.
application_process: 1. For Incubators: Submit proposal to KVIC for LBI/TBI establishment. 2. For Startups: Register on ASPIRE portal. 3. Apply to empaneled incubators with business plan. 4. Undergo selection process and due diligence. 5. Sign agreement and receive funding in tranches. 6. Utilize incubator facilities and mentorship. 7. Establish and scale business with continued support.
